qas.question: Throughout the Roaring Twenties, what public beach in New Haven was a favored destination for tourists?
Which famed professional baseball player is known to have visited at Lighthouse Point Park in New Haven during the 1920's?
What notable New Haven attraction constructed in 1847 was located at Lighthouse Point Park?
In what year was New Haven's Lighthouse Point carousel constructed?
In what year was Five Mile Point Lighthouse decommissioned upon construction of Southwest Ledge Lighthouse?
What popular tourist site was particularly active during the 20s?
In 1847, a new landmark was constructed at the park, what exactly was it?
After 1877 another lighthouse was build to replace File Mile Point, what was its' name?
Is Southwest Ledge Light still active today?

context: <a0_0><a5_0>Lighthouse Point Park<a5_0/><a0_0/>, a public beach run by the city, was a popular tourist destination during the Roaring Twenties, attracting luminaries of the period such as <a1_0>Babe Ruth<a1_0/> and Ty Cobb. The park remains popular among New Haveners, and is home to the <a2_0>Five Mile Point <a6_0>Lighthouse<a6_0/><a2_0/>, constructed in 1847, and the Lighthouse Point Carousel, constructed in <a3_0>1916<a3_0/>. Five Mile Point Light was decommissioned in <a4_0>1877<a4_0/> following the construction of <a7_0>Southwest Ledge Light<a7_0/> at the entrance of the harbor, which remains <a8_0>in service to this day<a8_0/>. Both of the lighthouses and the carousel are listed on the National Register of Historic Places.
